description:

title: Virtual Sales Consultant (Multi-Channel)
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW**  

TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.


TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.


**Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. At TriNet, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every single qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.**

  

  

**JOB SUMMARY/OVERVIEW**

As a Sales Consultant, with TriNet you'll help power business success with extraordinary HR by pursuing new prospects, sharing and quantifying our value proposition, and selling TriNet's comprehensive solutions. You'll prospect and build your own book of business for SaaS and ASO in emerging markets, own your opportunities, and execute the sales process. In an effort of exceeding quota, you'll build pipeline, conduct sales meetings with prospective clients via video conferencing, write proposals, gain approvals, and present those proposals to prospective clients, including C-level executives, business owners and other decision makers in midsize businesses.  



  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES**

Plan: Develop an annual plan to hit targets in assigned geographical market territories, may cover multiple states and/or regions and manage a diverse portfolio of industries.  

* 
  

Prospect: Consistently work on building a balanced pipeline of target prospects through traditional means of prospecting (email, phone, LinkedIn) as well as building and leveraging channel partners and marketing leads to develop referrals and business development opportunities.  

* 
  

Value & Consultative Selling: Establish a trusted advisor relationship, both internally at TriNet and within the prospect’s decision-making system, to effectively gain successful business and long-term client relationships.  

* 
  

Qualifying opportunities: Strong understanding of target markets and decision-making personas will help to qualify or disqualify quickly.  

* 
  

Sales Process: Utilize a sophisticated and multi-step selling process with defined criteria, executive sponsorship and internal business processes.  

* 
  

Sales tools and systems: Utilize Sales systems including Salesforce.com, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoominfo and quoting tools to efficiently and effectively manage daily activities.  

* 
  

Develop Channel Relationships: Rep will develop Channel Relationships such as internal PEO Reps, CPAs, Brokers and other ecosystem partners.  

* 
  

Achieve annual quota target by meeting sales activity metrics.  

* 
  

Complete all administrative tasks and duties in a timely manner.  

* 
  

Demonstrate TriNet’s Core Values daily.  

* 
  

* Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the manager’s discretion.
* Performs other duties as assigned
Complies with all policies and standards  
* 
  

**JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS**  

**Education:** Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, preferred  



**Experience:** Typically 3+ years experience in a closing role multi-stage, inbound B2B sales cycle role in SaaS, HRO, Cloud, HRIS, ERP, and/or technology. – REQUIRED
  

Proven SaaS, HCM and/or ASO experience is ideal. - PREFERRED  



**Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

Strong phone-based development skills required.  

* 
  

Ability to conduct online demos and virtual meetings.  

* 
  

Ability to work within a team environment.  

* 
  

Success with complex, consultative, C-level sales.  

* 
  

Strong business acumen and P&L analysis.  

* 
  

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills and presentation skills.  

* 
  

Ability to build your own book of business from prospecting, sourcing, establishing and maximizing partner and referral networks.  

* 
  

Ability to communicate with employees at all levels of the organization.  

* 
  

A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace.  

* 
  

Ability to build strong ecosystem partnerships and business referral relationships to share the value and mission of TriNet.  

* 
  

Ability to adapt to a fast paced continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities.  

* 
  

Experience with technology and common software and web applications, including MS Office and Salesforce.com or comparable CRM.  

* 
  

  

**WORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION (Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.)**

Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable home or office setting. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable persons with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Position may be considered remote and require reliable and consistent internet service.


  

**Travel Requirements:**

Minimal travel may be required on occasion.


The salary range for this role is $60,000 to $85,000. The candidate’s final salary offer will be based on the candidate’s skills, education, work location and experience.
  

  

Candidates hired into roles in the sales organization are also eligible for commissions consistent with TriNet’s commission plan.
  

  

Additionally, subject to applicable eligibility requirements, TriNet offers permanent full-time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, and vision plans, life and disability insurance, a 401(K) savings plan, an employee stock purchase plan, eleven (11) Company observed holidays, PTO and a comprehensive leave program. Please click the following link for detailed information about our benefits offerings https://www.trinet.com/documents/blt5b61a1040aae1904


Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity.


TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact recruiting@trinet.com to request such an accommodation.

title: Implementation Consultant
description:
Summary
The Implementation Consultant directly interfaces with our customers and partners to deliver solutions within current Workiva products that achieve customer outcomes. This role is focused on documentation, continued learning, and enablement for internal resources as well as our customers and partners. The Implementation Consultant works closely with other internal teams cross-functionally including project management, customer success, support, solution engineering, and product development.
Responsibilities* Leads the delivery of contracted services to customers and partners
* Performs detailed discovery sessions to understand business needs and requirements
* Creates a solution design that achieves outcomes within the Workiva platform
* Directly interfaces with customers and partners to deliver standardized solutions
* Maintains and enhances knowledge of financial, risk, or operational reporting using the Workiva platform through a commitment to ongoing training
* Participates in leading and mentoring peers as well as Associates, assisting onboarding as needed, and participates in ongoing training efforts.


What You'll Need
Minimum Qualifications* Undergraduate Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in a related field.
* 4 years of experience in service delivery roles, finance, accounting, audit, or a related field.


Preferred Qualifications* Bachelor’s degree or 2 years of experience with a Master’s degree
* Bilingual in Spanish preferred
* ESG, Sustainability reporting
* Experience with ERP, GRC, GL, FP&A, or Analytics and reporting solutions and their related technology platforms.
* Hands-on experience within the Workiva platform, other SaaS and cloud technologies, or data architectures preferred.
* Consultant level at a services company or public accounting preferred.
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to present topics clearly and succinctly
* Self-motivated with strong propensity for action, results, and continuous improvement
* Ability to influence and drive change in business processes
* A strong individual contributor with intellectual curiosity to positively impact the ability to manage multiple services.
* Enhanced technology knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite and Google Workspace applications. Familiarity with any of the following: SQL, JSON, REST, or Python is a plus
* Demonstrated ability to curate and maintain customer-first relationships

  

Travel* Up to 25% travel


Working Conditions & Physical Requirements* Reliable internet access for any period of time working remotely, not in a Workiva office.

How You’ll Be Rewarded:* Salary range in the US:


$69,000.00 - $117,000.00* A discretionary bonus typically paid annually
* Restricted Stock Units granted at time of hire
* 401(k) match and comprehensive employee benefits package


The salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this job in the US. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and other relevant factors.
Where You’ll Work
Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created.
We believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to make an impact everyday. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground. We hire talented people with a wide range of skills and experiences who are eager to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems.
At Workiva, you’ll enjoy:* Fantastic Benefits: With coverage starting day one, choose from competitive health, dental, and vision plans on the largest physician networks available.
* Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office.
* Involvement: Ability to participate in Business Employee Resource Groups (Black, Hispanic, Asian, Women, Rainbow (LGBTQIA+), Veterans, Disabilities), Volunteering, Company wide celebrations, and more
* Work-life Balance: We have competitive PTO, VTO and Parental Leave. We encourage employees to spend time enjoying life outside of work.

  

Learn more about life at Workiva: https://www.linkedin.com/company/workiva/
Learn more about benefits: https://www.workiva.com/careers/benefits  

Workiva is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other protected characteristic. We strongly encourage and welcome people from historically marginalized groups to apply.
Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com. *Workiva supports employees in working where they work best - either from an office or remotely from any location within their country of employment.*

title: Techno Functional Consultant - NetSuite
description:
**Overview:**


We are seeking a skilled and experienced NetSuite Techno-Functional Consultant to join our team. As a NetSuite Techno-Functional Consultant, you will play a key role in implementing and optimizing NetSuite solutions to meet the business needs of our clients. You will leverage your technical expertise and functional knowledge to design, customize, and configure NetSuite modules, workflows, and integrations, ensuring seamless alignment with business processes and requirements.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Gather and analyze business requirements from stakeholders to understand their needs and objectives.
* Translate business requirements into technical specifications and design customizations, workflows, and configurations within NetSuite.
* Configure NetSuite modules, including but not limited to Financials, CRM, Inventory Management, and Order Management, to meet client requirements.
* Develop and customize SuiteScripts (SuiteScript 1.0 and SuiteScript 2.0) to implement customizations, automations, and enhancements in NetSuite.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, project managers, and business analysts, to implement and integrate NetSuite solutions effectively.
* Conduct workshops, training sessions, and knowledge transfer sessions for end-users to ensure successful adoption and utilization of NetSuite functionalities.
* Perform data migration, cleansing, and validation activities to ensure data accuracy and integrity within NetSuite.
* Configure and maintain integrations between NetSuite and third-party systems using SuiteTalk, RESTlets, and other integration tools.
* Provide technical support, troubleshooting, and issue resolution for NetSuite implementations, ensuring timely resolution of issues and minimizing downtime.
* Stay updated on NetSuite releases, features, and best practices to leverage new functionalities and optimize existing solutions.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field.
* Minimum of 8 years of experience as a NetSuite Techno-Functional Consultant or similar role, with expertise in both technical and functional aspects of NetSuite.
* Proficient in configuring and customizing NetSuite modules, workflows, forms, and reports to meet business requirements.
* Strong understanding of NetSuite data model, record types, and customization capabilities.
* Hands-on experience with SuiteScript development (SuiteScript 1.0 and SuiteScript 2.0), including scripting APIs, debugging, and performance optimization.
* Experience with NetSuite integrations using SuiteTalk, RESTlets, SOAP web services, and other integration tools.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities effectively.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* NetSuite certification(s) such as SuiteFoundation, SuiteCloud Developer, or Administrator.
* Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies and SDLC practices.
* Knowledge of related technologies such as ERP systems, CRM platforms, and eCommerce solutions.

  
Location


Remote, United States


Salary


$75 - $77 /hour


Job Type


Contract


Date Posted


March 5th, 2024

title: Oracle Fusion Payables & Procurement Consultant #1825788
description:
**Oracle Fusion AP & Procurement Consultant**  
REMOTE, Contract

As an **Oracle Fusion AP & Procurement Consultant**, you will be responsible for driving the implementation and optimization of Oracle Fusion Payables and Procurement modules, focusing on Invoice Processing and Purchase Order Closure processes. You will play a key role in user adoption and ensuring a smooth transition. This is a fast-paced environment where you will be expected to take ownership and lead discussions with our global team.

**Qualifications**

* Minimum of 10 years of experience working in Oracle ERP Implementations.
* Relevant functional and technical experience with **Oracle Fusion Payables, Procurement,** and **Invoice Processing** including implementation, configuration, and support experience.
* Experience in working on multiple implementations in Financial Applications using Oracle Fusion Cloud versions.
* **Extensive experience with Oracle Fusion Payables**, with a deep focus on recent implementations and enhancements in **Invoice Processing**, especially **Invoice Imaging (IDR)** functionalities.
* **Understanding of AI or knowledge of AI applications** in the context of Oracle Fusion Payables is a significant advantage.
* Experience working with **Oracle Projects; Project Planning and Scheduling, Resource Management, Budgeting and Cost Control, and Reporting.**
* Background in Accounting and **working with Accounting teams**
* Deep understanding of accounting practices, principles, and all Finance business processes.
* Able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders/customers
* Strong analytical skills and ability to think in a complex and rapidly changing environment
* Experience in OTBI and FRWS Report development.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead the implementation and optimization of Oracle Fusion Payables and Procurement modules, leveraging the power of Oracle AI to further optimize processes and enhance efficiency.
* Deep dive into Invoice Processing functionalities, focusing on Invoice Imaging (IDR) enhancements.
* Analyze user needs and develop solutions to optimize efficiency and accuracy in Payables and Procurement processes, potentially utilizing **Oracle AI capabilities** where applicable.
* Configure and customize the system to meet specific business requirements, ensuring **alignment with best practices and potential integration with Oracle AI solutions**.
* Lead user training sessions and ensure smooth user adoption of the new system, effectively **communicating the potential benefits of Oracle AI** where relevant.
* Collaborate with global teams to address concerns and ensure a successful implementation, **demonstrating expertise in Oracle Fusion Payables, Procurement, and Invoice Processing** and their benefits.

***To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and qualifications.***

-------

Our core values (Accountability, Excellence, Integrity, and Community) guide us in providing optimized results and unparalleled service. title: Product Manager - Business Assets
description:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About the Team
Our Assets Product Management team at Workday empowers our customers with intuitive experiences, groundbreaking innovation, and business compliance that drive digital transformation and operational efficiency. As part of the industry-leading Workday Financial Management Product Management team, we lead product roadmaps, design features, and develop new products to meet customer and market needs. We collaborate closely with customers, our strategy teams, and implementation and support leadership to ensure our products empower digital transformations in the office of the CFO.
About the Role
Are you a finance professional, a consultant, a business analyst, or a product owner? Have you been a super-user, made configurations, or been part of integrations or implementations of ERP or financial management systems? We want your perspective and fresh ideas to contribute to our next generation Business Assets solution!
We need an independent product leader who is passionate about solving sophisticated and ambiguous problems in a fast-paced environment. Work alongside UX, engineering and business partners to drive significant outcomes for Workday and our customers.
When you join Workday as a Product Manager, you will gain in-depth knowledge of our applications, product development methodology, and processes through formal and informal training to become the owner of the functional application design for your domain. You will combine your functional and systems knowledge to analyze customer business processes, their system environment, and assemble business requirements. You will collaborate internally to turn these requirements into next-generation business applications. We apply agile development methodologies, and you will be the voice of the product management team to ensure that the product you intend to build, gets delivered.
About You
You are: an inspiring leader who can share the excitement of innovation and customer value creation; a fast learner, who's meticulous, decisive, and enjoys a fast-paced work environment. You are a standout teammate and thrive in a collaborative, agile, continuous discovery, and continuous delivery approach.
Basic Qualifications* 3+ years of experience as a product manager
* Experience developing or implementing enterprise applications, such as Finance, HCM, CRM or others
* BS / BA / MS / MA degree or equivalent work experience


Other Qualifications* Experience developing or implementing enterprise applications, such as Finance, HCM, CRM or others.
* Functional knowledge of fixed assets and capital projects is an advantage.
* Knowledge of international accounting standards and regulations related to fixed assets, including IFRS and GAAP, is desirable but not crucial.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Proven track record as the voice of the customer for multiple teams and projects.


Please apply and join the revolution of cloud based, user friendly enterprise software systems of tomorrow.
Workday Pay Transparency Statement
The annualized base salary ranges for the primary location and any additional locations are listed below. Workday pay ranges vary based on work location. As a part of the total compensation package, this role may be eligible for the Workday Bonus Plan or a role-specific commission/bonus, as well as annual refresh stock grants. Recruiters can share more detail during the hiring process. Each candidate’s compensation offer will be based on multiple factors including, but not limited to, geography, experience, skills, job duties, and business need, among other things. For more information regarding Workday’s comprehensive benefits, please click here.
Primary Location: CAN.BC.Vancouver
Primary CAN Base Pay Range: $102,900 - $154,300 CAD
Additional US Location(s) Base Pay Range: $112,100 USD - $204,000 USD  

Our Approach to Flexible Work  

With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
Pursuant to applicable Fair Chance law, Workday will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.
Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

title: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Consultant
description:
**Company Profile:**

Vision Planning and Consulting, LLC (VPC) specializes in business continuity, technology solutions, hazard mitigation, community planning, grants management, web development, and public outreach. We pride ourselves in creating synergies between all levels of government, academia, and the public, and developing strategies that result in safe, sustainable, communities, and preparing them to meet short- and long-term challenges.

**Position Description:**

VPC is seeking **candidates for an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Consultant.** Thisposition will provide support to one of our clients in the southeast United States. The ideal candidate would possess 5-10 years of ERP experience; however, mature candidates are encouraged to apply. The position will provide **remote** support as a 1099 Contractor, and may include some **potential travel** to the project site in South Florida.

**Duration:**

Ten (10) to twelve (12) months.

**Pay:**

The hourly rate for this position is $65-$80/hour.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conducts an assessment with County departments and stakeholders.
* Assesses and procures an ERP like Workday, Oracle, SAP.
* Creates an RFP document with specifications for an ERP.
* Assists with proposal responses.
* Assists with facilitating vendor demonstrations
* Determines requirements for proposals.
* Writes specifications for proposals and the RFP.
* Reviews and helps score proposals.
* Reviews business practices.
* Provides implementation assistance.

**Qualifications/Skill Requirements:**

* Possesses business and technical skill sets.
* Working knowledge and experience in organizational change management, systems integration, and data migration.
* Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to develop and communicate the project. objectives, inspire and motivate staff, and maintain alignment with the business strategy.
* Possesses a high degree of political sensitivity, astuteness, and the ability to effectively use the informal power structure of the organization to achieve success and clear obstacles for the project.
* Ability to multi-task and work effectively under pressure and with deadlines.
* Highly empathetic and able to vary styles of interaction to match the needs of a variety of temperaments and personalities.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain and "sell" the project goals and objectives to the organization, as well as technical leadership.
* Effective influencing and negotiation experience and skills in an environment with high competition for resources.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and deliver against financial and resource constraints.
* Knowledge of project planning tools, such as Microsoft Project and Jira, with evidence of practical application.
* Deep understanding of current and emerging technologies, how other enterprises are employing them to drive digital business.
* Demonstrated and proven ability to work with multi-discipline teams, analyze problems, propose solutions, drive issues to resolution, and make decisions, both individually and in a group.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills; ability to prioritize and complete tasks in a timely manner, with a strong attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Government experience is preferred.

VPC is looking to fill this position **as soon as possible.**

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $65.00 - $80.00 per hour

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract

Experience level:

* 5 years

title: Oracle ERP consultant
description:
**About us**

HAND Enterprise Solutions was established in 1996 in Asia Pacific and is now a leading global software service provider and developer. As the pioneer in IT consulting service field in China, HAND has the grandest company size and handles a great number of ambitious projects. HAND opened up their USA headquarters in Milpitas, CA in 2016 and set up their delivery center in Farmington Hills, MI in 2019. HAND Enterprise Solutions has been awarded top level Partnership status by both SAP and Oracle. HAND is credited with over 10,000 projects related to ORACLE and SAP implementations, supported by 10,000+ consultants and most importantly, 3,000 successful customers worldwide. HAND concentrates on several industry verticals such as manufacturing, finance, trade, telecommunication, e-commerce, media, and real estate.

**Job Descriptions**

* Participate in all phases of Oracle ERP (Oracle EBS or Oracle Fusion) project implementation, including requirements gathering, system design, configuration, testing, and training.
* Collaborate with clients to understand their business processes and requirements and provide expert advice on Oracle FIN(Finance), SCM(Supply Chain) & MFG(Manufacturing) best practices.
* Configure and customize Oracle FIN, SCM & MFG system to meet client's specific needs, including finance foundations, warehouse structure, master data, process flows, and integration with other Oracle modules and legacy systems.
* Conduct user training and provide post-go-live support to ensure smooth transition and effective system utilization.
* Project management/team lead activities depends on the role of the project

**Skill Sets Requirements**

* 3 years or above of Oracle EBS or Oracle Fusion implementation experience
* Familiar with Oracle EBS or Oracle Fusion FIN, SCM or MFG functionalities, including Oracle Finance (GL, AP, AR, FA), Oracle Inventory, Purchasing, Order Management, or Oracle manufacturing (discrete manufacturing or process manufacturing)
* Able to conduct business requirements collection, solution design and system configuration based on Oracle EBS or Oracle Fusion
* Able to design and new RICE objects in Oracle EBS or Oracle Fusion
* Good communication skills
* Have project manager role or team lead role experience is a plus
* Mandarin speaking capability is a strong plus

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

description:
General information
Country

Job ID
38792


Description & Requirements
The Pre-Sales Senior Solution Consultant (SC) provides expertise to Infor prospects and customers in support of Infor’s ERP license revenue and customer success. The SC provides applicable industry and software knowledge to help share compelling solutions for our customers. The successful SC possesses business acumen and an ability to understand our customers’ business needs and challenges through discovery to deliver strategic, industry-competitive solutions. In addition, the SC will work closely with the sales organization to provide compelling solutions, presentations, and demos while becoming the trusted advisor of our customers.

  

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

* Understands client’s critical business issues and demonstrates compelling, value-based solutions using Infor’s software capabilities.
* Work with individuals throughout the sales organization to develop an overall account and opportunity strategy.
* Apply product knowledge, presentation skills, and technical understanding to effectively present Infor products to prospects and customers.
* Mentor and assist in training junior SCs.
* Maintain knowledge of industry trends and competitive products.
* Answer functional questions related to the product line in Requests for Proposals (RFP’s)
* Maintain strong functional knowledge of new Infor solution capabilities to ensure Infor is best positioned to meet our customer’s needs.
* Challenges sales teams to think beyond the surface messaging to develop their storytelling capabilities, building impact, and credibility throughout the buyer journey.

  

Basic Qualifications:

* Experience in solution consulting (pre-sales), selling, using, and/or implementing ERP LN.
* Business process experience in Discrete Manufacturing, Sales, Warehousing, Planning, and/or purchasing.
* Experience sharing software sales presentations and/or demos.
* Ability to travel 40% or more.

  

Preferred Qualifications:

* Experience with Infor LN.
* Ability to work independently from a remote location.


Job Location: US Remote (Alpharetta, GA, Dallas, TX, St. Paul, MN)

  

  

About Infor  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
For more information visit www.infor.com  


Our Values  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law.  

  

At Infor we value your privacy that’s why we created a policy that you can read here.  


This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

title: PLM Implementation Consultant
description:
D3 provides its team members the room to grow and the support & leadership to succeed with great earning potential. Our team members are also passionate about what they do and get a strong feeling of accomplishment because they make a positive impact in the success of the customers they serve!... Our customers love us & appreciate us for serving them!

**JOB TITLE:** PLM Implementation Consultant

**About the Opportunity:**


The D3 team works with clients to improve their design data processes and workflows throughout the enterprise. We provide business services such as process improvement (PDM/PLM), data integration, design automation and overall consulting services. We specialize in Autodesk and other best in class technologies that provide clients immediate time to value. PDM Solutions along with multi-tenant, true Software as a Service (SaaS) PLM Solutions are changing the way Manufacturers of all sizes deal with enterprise data challenges. This is an exciting and fast paced environment that is both challenging and rewarding.

**JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**


PLM consulting and implementation expertise for our top manufacturing clients across the US.

* System Implementation: Ability to configure and implement cloud technology platform, along with data integration solutions, to the client specific workflows. Experience with a broad range of business workflows is a real advantage (i.e. Engineering Management (BOM & Change), Quality Management, New Product Introduction (NPI/NPD), Program Management, etc.)
* Project Contributor: Work as a vital contributor to consulting projects, interfacing with both internal and external team members, following the approved project scope and communicating status, issues, and changes through to the appropriate people.
* PDM/PLM Resource Management: Ideal candidate would have a broad understanding of product data management (PDM) and product lifecycle management (PLM) practices and be able to facilitate client discovery, prepare documentation workflows, and provide presentation of solutions.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* College degree or equivalent work experience
* General knowledge of manufacturing business systems and/or processes (CRM, ERP, PDM, PLM, MES, and CAD)
* Strong attention to detail
* Excellent communicator, both verbal and written
* Basic knowledge of Cloud System and Software as a Service (SaaS)

**ADDITIONAL CONSIDERATIONS FOR:**

* **PLM Consulting**: Experience in the areas of product data management (PDM), product lifecycle management (PLM), enterprise resource planning (ERP), new product introduction (NPI) practices.
* **Business Analysis**: Supporting sales and solutions engineers by conducting business process analysis in both PDM and PLM client engagements. Ability to facilitate client discovery, prioritize time to value, prepare systems architecture/document workflows and ultimately, presentation of PDM/PLM Solutions.
* Basic scripting knowledge (JavaScript)

**LOCATION & TERRITORY:**

* Territory will cover clients across the U.S.
* Willingness to travel overnight, estimated 15%.

 **EOE/Veteran/Disabled**

title: Project Manager (SAP ERP)
description:
**PROJECT MANAGER (SAP ERP Project Implementation)**

**Requisition #:** R24-2998

**Location:** St. Albert, AB (Hybrid - 1 day on-site every 2 weeks)

**Engagement Type:** Contract

**Number of Resources required:** 2

**Rate (CAD):** Up to $90 per hour / Commensurate with related experience and market competitiveness

**Term:** 12 months (2024-03-18 to 2025-03-31) with 12 month extension available (up to 24-month contract)

**Hours per day:** 7.25

**Security Screening:** Standard (Criminal Record Check)

**Submit to Tri-global:** March 5, 2024 (on or before 12:00 PM Mountain Time)

**Closing Date:** March 6, 2024 (10:00 AM Mountain Time)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tri-global Solutions Group Inc. is seeking two (2) Project Manager (SAP ERP Project Implementation) to join our talented Service Delivery team at Alberta Gaming, Liquor, and Cannabis in supporting the successful project delivery of a complex, large-scale Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Transformation Project.

*NOTES ON LOCATION: The successful candidate will work in a hybrid arrangement - minimum of 1 day on-site every 2 weeks at 50 Corriveau Avenue, St. Albert, AB. Work must be done from within Canada, due to network and data security policies. Standard Hours of work are 08:15 - 16:30 Alberta time.*

Please review the project overview and requirements below. If you meet the requirements and are interested in submitting for this role, please reply to this job posting.

If you know other consultants who may be interested in this opportunity kindly share this job posting.

Thank you.

Tri-global Solutions Group Inc.

Website: https://tri-global.com

------------------------------------------------------------------------

**PROJECT OVERVIEW**

AGLC’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)Transformation Project is about reimagining the way we facilitate our core finance, supply chain, and human resources functions –providing increased opportunity to streamline, automate and align processes with leading practices through the use of modernized enterprise-class ERP technologies and enabling master data management and customer relationship management enterprise capabilities.

**ADDITIONAL DETAILS**

We seek a Project Manager with complex large-scale project experience to supplement our ERP team for successful project delivery.

Summary: Application of project management rigor and expertise will result in successful projects delivered on-time, on-budget and with deliverables that meet the expectations of the business and/or end users. The Project Manager will utilize AGLC project management standards to ensure that adopted practices and processes are applied throughout the project life-cycle. The Project Manager will share their expertise with the Project Lead, other project managers and project team members. The primary work location is remote/online with a requirement to work from the office if required.

**DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES**

Responsible for the coordination and completion of IT projects. Oversees all aspects of projects. Sets deadlines, assigns responsibilities, and monitors and summarizes progress of project. Builds and maintains working relationships with team members, vendors, and other departments involved in the projects. Prepares reports for upper management regarding status of project.

* Compile project charters and business/project plans to support activities, including the most suitable approach to be used in the development of each applicable project, to ensure business objectives and data integrity are achieved.
* Manage project(s) that will document business requirements, design and deliver IT solutions that are compliant with and contribute to the Ministries’ enterprise architecture.
* Assist with the development of recommendations including providing details of resource requirements, dependencies, interdependencies, policy implications pertaining to internal/external influences and the methodology to be applied.
* Produce and package deliverables for presentation to various internal support teams, steering committee, and other project stakeholders.
* Manage multiple projects, project resources and project governance.
* Work with project sponsors to ensure that effective project communication exists through the duration of the project including escalation of risks as required.
* Take responsibility for ongoing client satisfaction – manage peer-level client relationships and overcome hurdles to ensure win-win solutions.
* Collaborate with business and IT leadership to develop a well-defined project plan that clearly states the project’s objectives, scope, assumptions, timeline, resource requirements, risks, benefits and budget.
* Work with project sponsors and the project management office to develop a project organization structure with clearly defined roles and responsibilities for all stakeholders.
* Document and report project status against established objectives, milestones, budget and resources and facilitate tracking and closure of issues and risks.
* Develop project schedule plans and strategies, estimate resource requirements, develop and monitor work plans and take corrective action for completion of project tasks.
* Provide guidance to project resources in establishing work priorities and prompt delivery of project tasks.
* Develop, as required, related requirements documentation.
* In collaboration with project sponsors, assess whether the project achieved stated outcomes and identify opportunities for improvement for future similar projects.
* Provide leadership and assistance to business and project teams that require change management and communication support.
* Work within the standards defined by the project management office and in the absence of standards work with the project management office to define new standards.

**MANDATORY SKILLS**

M1 Proposed resource must meet or exceed one of the following (Please provide dates in response): (12+ years)

- University degree in business, management or related discipline & 8-yr Project Manager (PM) experience;

OR

- 2-yr diploma in business, management or related discipline & 10-yr PM experience;

OR

- 1-yr certificate in business, management or related discipline & 11-yr PM experience;

M2 Demonstrated experience working as a Project Manager on a large complex software application development project in an environment of similar size and complexity to the AGLC (8+ years)

M3 Experience defining/managing project scope and goals in collaboration with business stakeholders (8+ years)

M4 Experience developing project deliverables including project charters, business cases, briefing notes, status reports, risk logs and project closures (8+ years)

M5 Demonstrated experience managing IT application development projects with large teams (at least 5 team members) (8+ years)

M6 Available to lead frequent (daily) face-to-face / remote meetings with clients and technical teams as required (8+ years)

**DESIRABLE / NICE TO HAVE SKILLS**

D1 Currently active PMP or PRINCE2 or equivalent certification as issued by the Project Management Institute or equivalent (attach a copy of the certificate)

D2 Experience creating and managing project GANTT charts in Microsoft Project (7+ years)

D3 Experience leading and facilitating meetings with stakeholders at all levels (5+ years)

D4 Experience leading change management and communication planning (5+ years)

D5 Experience developing and maintaining positive stakeholder relationships across the organization, including executive level (5+ years)

D6 Experience using MS Project tools in a project server environment (5+ years)

D7 Experience working with staff, contractors and vendor teams (7+ years)

D8 Working knowledge of Agile software development methodology and scrum process (2+ years)

D9 Ability to work closely with Process Owners and other key stakeholders to communicate progress (5+ years)

D10 Deep understanding of project implementation methodology (7+ years)

D11 Experience managing resources throughout the project delivery lifecycle (7+ years)

D12 Experience working on a large/complex projects working with multiple Project Managers (3+ years)

D13 Do you have related Canadian education (e.g. certificate, diploma or degree) or your foreign credentials certified by Immigration Canada, IQAS or any accreditation acceptable to the Government of Canada or Alberta? If applicable, provide information regarding certification of foreign credentials.

**NOT FOR YOU?**

Check out our other opportunities at https://tri-global.com or follow us on LinkedIn. We thank all candidates in advance. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

**WHY WORK WITH TRI-GLOBAL?**

- Empower positive change by enabling our clients to revolutionize innovation and technology, elevating them to a higher level of excellence and efficiency.

- Join an exceptional and committed team that redefines the landscape, forging a distinctive path towards success.

- Engage in stimulating and captivating projects that push boundaries and keep you constantly motivated.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to $90.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Work from home

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

* Project Manager on a large complex software app dev project: 8 years (required)
* define/manage scope & goals in collaboration w/ stakeholders: 8 years (required)
* develop project deliverables: charters, business cases, etc.: 8 years (required)
* managing IT application dev projects with teams >5 members: 8 years (required)
* creating & manage project GANTT charts in Microsoft Project: 7 years (preferred)
* lead & facilitate meetings with stakeholders at all levels: 7 years (preferred)

title: Solutions Consultant - ERP, Remote
description:
**Who We Are:**
We are a national, innovative, high-growth software company devoted to K12 education administration. Our products beat the competition by focusing on all business operations of K12 schools, including both financial and school nutrition management. We have a deep understanding of K12 school systems and regulations, with a focus on providing creative, integrated and user-friendly solutions supported by excellent customer service. Our workforce is talented, loyal, dedicated and highly enthusiastic. This is a fantastic career opportunity for the right individual.  

We offer challenging work in a team environment. We respect each other and collaborate for continuous improvement. We are the experts in our product lines and we anticipate the needs of our customers. Our customers say we work efficiently and always strive to provide the proper solution. We have achieved this by building relationships based upon:expertise, patience, attentiveness, clear positive communication, tenacity, and a calm presence.

LINQ is on a mission to empower central office heroes who make K-12 districts and schools stronger. LINQ improves efficiency, optimizes performance, and manages compliance through its suite of administrative, financial, and nutritional solutions; allowing administrators to make a bigger impact for their staff, students, and communities. LINQ is the first company to deliver a full suite of integrated solutions to manage operations at the state, district, and school levels. LINQ has helped over 30,000 schools and served over 17 million students to increase K-12 potential. **LINQ’s Values:**
Count on us **-** We’re ready and reliable for our partners and each other
Class of our own - We hold ourselves to a high standard of excellence
Fair and Square - Integrity and mutual respect are table stakes
Nourish Connection - We foster a culture of teamwork and trust
Educated Advancement - Our deep knowledge and experience propel our development  

The Solutions Consultant role at LINQ is a key position responsible for effectively communicating and demonstrating the value of LINQ as a partner to K-12 Education. As the ambassador and expert on LINQ solutions, you will play a crucial role in delivering compelling presentations that enhance the buyer journey and contribute to closing and retaining business.

At LINQ, we prioritize our culture, and as a Solutions Consultant, you will become part of a close-knit community of presales professionals. You will also have the opportunity to support some of the best sales representatives in the K-12 technology space.

In this role, you will enjoy a flexible working environment, engaging in various tasks such as collaborating on market messaging, understanding the needs of clients and prospects, crafting persuasive stories and messages, configuring solutions, and delivering presentations.

As a Solution Consultant, you will be seen as a trusted advisor within the organization. Your responsibilities will include supporting sales teams in opportunity management, strategy development, conducting discovery sessions, responding to requests for proposals (RFPs), enabling sales tools, fostering internal collaboration, and engaging in strategic work across departments.**Responsibilities:*** Deliver compelling and dynamic presentations, demonstrations, conferences, workshops, and seminars of LINQ's solutions and enterprise story.
* Assist in the sales development/discovery process to understand the needs of potential clients.


Utilize advanced storytelling techniques to effectively communicate LINQ's value proposition.* Assist in closing sales opportunities by demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of our solutions, services, and training.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to align messaging strategies.
* Develop in-depth knowledge of multiple solutions across the LINQ platform.
* Provide field-based feedback to our development team regarding enhancements based on market needs.
* Support sales methodology execution, including strategy development with internal resources tailored to each sales opportunity.
* Respond to RFPs/RFIs and assist with final production, such as executive summaries.
* Address complex questions from existing and potential clients.
* Support the smooth handoff of customers from Sales to our Services organization after the close of a complex sale.
* Assist with implementation, support, and customer retention as needed.
* Travel is required, ranging from 50-75% and occasionally on short notice.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**Qualifications :*** Experience in ERP software with a combination of technical skills, business acumen, enterprise reporting and project management capabilities to successfully implement and leverage ERP systems to support organizational objectives.
* Ability to quickly learn new technology and software across multiple domains of school business software.
* Proficiency in delivering compelling visionary presentations with advanced skills in audience engagement, storytelling, and the use of technology tools.
* Prior experience in presales, consulting, or training in ERP and/or Technology.
* Ability to effectively manage multiple challenging and rewarding projects simultaneously.
* Thrives in a fast-paced, ever-changing work environment.
* Strong team-oriented mindset.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Demonstrates exceptional cross-group collaboration and general management skills, with the ability to build relationships within an organization.


**Total Rewards:**
Remote working environment
Ability to work in a physical office, if near one of our 3 offices (Wilmington, Irvine, and Scottsdale)
One America 401k plan with 4% employer matching on total earnings, not just base (100% fully vested)
Company Bonus Plan or Target Sales Commission Plan
Flexible Open Paid Time Off Plan
10 paid holidays
16 hours of paid volunteer time
Blue Cross Blue Shield benefit network (medical/dental/vision)
Low-deductible PPO option or HDHP option with employer contributed HSA
Dental with child orthodontia
100% Employer paid Short Term Disability/Long Term Disability/Basic Life/Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance
Health and wellness benefits including gym and Headspace reimbursement
Professional development opportunities
**EOE Statement/Accommodation Notice:**
LINQ is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Equal Employment Opportunity Posters If you’d like to view a copy of the company’s affirmative action plan or policy statement, please email HRHelp@linq.com. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Lydia Buurma at HRHelp@linq.com. This email address is reserved solely for job seekers with disabilities requesting accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Please do not use this email to inquire about the status of your job application if you do not require accessibility assistance or an accommodation. Messages left for other purposes, such as following up on an application or non-disability related technical issues, will not receive a response.

title: Consultant
description:
Yardi is a global software company providing innovative property management solutions and services in every real estate market. We are focused on providing our customers with superior products and outstanding customer service. We are passionate about technology and believe work should be fulfilling and fun! We are committed to our customers, employees and the communities where we live.



We are looking for a dynamic team player with phenomenal people skills to train clients, support software implementations, and foster strong client relationships for Yardi’s Affordable Housing product!


**What you will do**


* Use your strong teaching skills to effectively train clients on Yardi’s Affordable Housing software platform
* Perform complex system and business reviews and other service reviews to improve efficiency and make sound recommendations for client productivity gains
* Use your strong interpersonal skills and positive attitude to establish rapport with clients, build sustaining alliances and influence beneficial outcomes
* Determine and document solutions and best practices to contribute to a solutions repository
* Focus on best practices and provide recommendations to clients regarding ancillary products and services that align with our client’s business and operational needs and goals
* Be part of a strong team and work internally with analysts, designers, developers, sales, and marketing teams with a focus on meeting and exceeding client expectations and maintaining optimum levels of customer service support
* Provide both virtual and onsite training – up to 80% of your time
* May have to travel 1-3 weeks on the road per month


**What you need to have**


* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Math, or Computer Science or other equivalent degree or experience in the property management industry
* 5 years of experience in software or business process consulting, or equivalent consulting experience interacting with customers
* 3 years of experience managing projects on accounting, business process, property management, or real estate software
* Prior experience working with ERP systems
* Awesome written and verbal communication skills
* Confidence and the ability to positively influence clients, peers and management
* High comfort level troubleshooting and problem-solving issues
* A love for organization and the ability to effectively manage multiple projects
* Great people skills and a desire to work in a team-oriented environment
* Critical thinking skills – you are strategic and are comfortable challenging assumptions and recommending the implementation of new ideas and strategies


**What would be helpful to have**

* Yardi domain experience
* Knowledge of the property management industry and Yardi’s competitors


**What you get as a Yardi Employee**


* A great place to work with fantastic people
* Ability to learn new technology and develop professionally
* Annual compensation range $93,600 - $105,300
* Comprehensive benefits – Medical/dental, paid time off, sick time, paid holidays, 401(k), profit sharing, life insurance, and more!


At Yardi, we’ve created a team of over 9,000 employees in over 40 locations around the globe dedicated to making great real estate software products and fostering a collaborative work environment. Yardi is a place where people with a wide variety of cultural and life experiences come together to make a difference. Our corporate culture stresses integrity, respect, trust, responsibility, and fun! Come join our growing team!



All submissions for open positions should be received through Yardi’s applicant portal, accessed from Yardi’s corporate website.
