title: Project Management Consultant III
description:
Job Description:
The Consultant III will work on project teams implementing Vertex’s Cloud and On-Premise products with host applications such as SAP and/or Oracle, JD Edwards, or other strategic partner applications - and the implementation of Vertex’s tax technology solutions. This role focuses on delivering services and project deliverables in support of the deployment of Vertex tax technology products. This role requires domain knowledge in tax, Vertex Products, and one or more Vertex software partner host applications. The role requires the ability to effectively identify and deliver tax process solutions and other value-added services that contribute to Vertex’s revenue and profit objectives.
Essential job functions AND responsibilities:* Collaborate with experienced Senior Consultants on implementation projects while executing on client’s statement of work (SOW).
* Proactively continually develop a basic knowledge of consulting methodologies and the Vertex market/ecosystem through the delivery of consulting services and participating in formal and informal learning opportunities.
* Continues learning the consulting role, gains industry knowledge and project implementation skills and takes guidance from senior Vertex Consultants and contributes to projects as needed.
* Participate in all phases of a Vertex software implementation by adhering to Vertex’s best practice methodology.
* Assists with all phases of Vertex projects including, review and analysis of client requirements, solution design and build, testing and providing client support as needed.
* Conducts solution design, Vertex application configuration, and solution documentation to help deliver successful implementations.
* Exercise sound judgment to manage the day to day client relationship and expectations.
* Responsible for maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction
* When appropriate assist consulting Business Development in developing statements of work.
* May assist with the training and development of new team members


Supervisory responsibilities:
Yes
Knowledge, skills and abilities:* Knowledge of implementation/consulting, customer service and vendor practices.
* Knowledge of software development methodologies and implementation/testing techniques appropriate to Windows, Legacy and/or client server database applications.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks, work in a team environment and understand the be responsive to project and customer needs.
* Ability to adapt and function effectively in a fast-paced, changing environment, while working under deadlines.
* Solid analytical, presentation, trouble-shooting and design skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* ERP knowledge a plus
* Ability to maintain expected attendance at work.
* Effective time management skills
* Ability to manage job-related and personal stress effectively.
* Has or has gained knowledge and understanding of the Vertex business, our industry and marketplace.
* Sufficient knowledge of business communications, including telephone, voicemail, and e-mail, and operations of office machines, such as photocopier, scanner, and fax.
* Willingness to work overtime, holidays, and weekends based on business need.


EDUCATION and TRAINING:* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent required.
* 4 -7 years of relevant work experience in a corporate environment through internships or recent work experience.
* Four (4) plus years of Project Management experience in the development of commercial software offerings.
* Four (4) plus years of experience in managing multiple projects.
* Professional PMP certification is preferred or equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
  

Essential Job Results applicable to all positions at Vertex:* Contribute to customer satisfaction by consistently meeting and/or exceeding expectations and commitments to both internal and external customers; by solving customer problems quickly and effectively while demonstrating good interpersonal skills; and by seeking ways to improve the value of Vertex products and services.
* Contribute to a highly productive work environment by striving for excellence through exceeding expectations; following and/or improving on established work procedures and methodology; responding to information flow in a timely manner; and acting on performance improvement opportunities where available.
* Foster effective communication and work relationships by practicing active listening skills in order to first understand others and effectively communicating the same.
* Embrace continuous improvement by proposing new and/or better ways of doing things; supporting the creative and innovative ideas of others; seeking to enhance the core competencies of Vertex wherever possible; and by being receptive and willing to change.
* Promote the fiscal and operational vitality of Vertex by demonstrating an awareness, understanding and fulfillment of the stewardship responsibility which all employees have for the sound use and preservation of the resources, tools and equipment made available to them; and by demonstrating an understanding of, and adherence to, all Vertex Corporate Policies, Procedures and Guidelines.

title: Implementation Consultant - Fiix
description:
Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.
We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!
Job Description
About Us
Rockwell is on a mission to build better maintenance teams by connecting customers to the tools, resources, and technology they need to join the future of maintenance. We help our customers drive better outcomes with easy-to-use, AI-driven maintenance software (FIIX), an open ecosystem, pre-built integrations and the industry expertise they need for maintenance success. There are over 3000 maintenance teams in 100+ countries using Fiix to improve communication, asset health, and even sustainability.
You will be fully remote but will require travel (domestic and international). You will report to the Senior Manager, Implementation Consulting.
What you will do:* Be the sole or primary contact for clients during the implementation phase of their journey.
* Enable clients to take full advantage of our industry-leading technology and deploy solutions in a manner that encourages end-user adoption, minimizes "time to value", and supports expansion over time.
* Engage directly with clients to understand their requirements, identify implementation success factors, develop best-fit solution designs, and configure the CMMS to meet their specific needs.
* Manage client expectations; identify implementation risks, capture and disseminate key project decisions and insights, and control project scope, quality, & timeline.
* Develop and deliver client training programs, including the creation of client training material (e.g. documents and videos).
* Assist clients with the collection, loading, and configuration of data.
* Develop client reports and dashboard KPIs & widgets.
* Support system integrations between Fiix & ERP systems.
* Record project progress and store all project artefacts in a central repository.
* Collaborate with teammates to identify, refine, and implement CMMS & implementation best practices.
* Assist with the training & development of new Implementation Consultants.
* Travel up to 40% of the time.
* *Measures of Success:* *customer feedback, utilization %, contribution to team initiatives.*


Basic Qualifications:* Bachelor's Degree
* Legal authorization to work in Canada is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas in this role, now or in the future.
* Ability to travel internationally.


Preferred Qualification:* 2+ years experience in a software implementation role; SaaS and/or CMMS software experience.
* Prior experience in the Maintenance and Reliability industry.
* Prior experience translating customer requirements into workable software solutions.
* Prior experience in Project Management leading small and medium software implementations. including experience developing work-breakdown structures and managing project plans.
* Ability to work Eastern Standard Time Hours.
* Valid Driver's License and Passport.


What We Offer:* Health Insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision
* Wellness Benefits
* Paid Time off
* Defined Contribution Pension Plan
* Parental and Caregiver Leave


#LI-JG1
#LifeatROK
#LI-Remote*This role is part of a job family and experience will be the determining factor regarding level and compensation.**Rockwell prides itself on its workforce diversity. We do not discriminate in hiring based on gender, race, ethnicity, religion or disability. Rockwell is a proud employer of veterans.*
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans.
If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at +1 (519) 618-4899.

title: Business Applications Consultant (Construction Focused)
description:
Are you ready to take on a pivotal role as our Business Applications Consultant, where your technology and construction industry skills come together to make an impact on clients?

Join our dynamic team and make a significant impact as you collaborate with clients, predominately from the construction sector, guiding them through the implementation and continuous utilization of our cutting-edge software tools to tackle complex data-related challenges.

Syscon, Inc, established in 1986, provides technology solutions and computer technical support services to our clients. We care deeply about our clients and at Syscon Inc, we foster a culture where our company, employees, and clients grow and succeed together.

**As a successful member of our Syscon team, YOU:**

* Care and are compassionate about people, treat clients and each other with respect.
* Empower our clients to use tech and see each task, whether mundane, as an opportunity to help to take away our client’s pain points.
* Have a team mentality - it’s always “we”, never “me” or never a “not my job” attitude. Everyone on our team owns their part. Have no ego, no drama; we’re a team. Nothing is beneath us.
* Ask for help, dive in, and dig deep to find the solutions.
* Take pride in self-initiative, put in the work, show an ownership mentality, and own your part.
* Embrace growth, readily accept constructive feedback, see your mistakes as opportunities to learn rather than seeing them as blame.
* Give and receive feedback (good and bad) and use it to improve self and your work.

**We believe that you will be successful in the Business Applications Consultant role if you have:**

* Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience serving in a support role capacity in a professional office setting
* IT service industry or MSP experience a plus
* Construction industry knowledge highly desirable.
* A great attitude
* Love to learn and possess a curious mindset to discover more

**As our Key Business Applications Consultant, in working with our clients, your objectives:**

* Define and create Microsoft Power BI Reports

* Strong communication skills; including documentation, end user communication, and communication with developers
* Strong personal skills including effective time management, self-driven, and prioritization
* Bonus skills: Experience creating SharePoint sites and experience with Microsoft Power Apps

**Come grow with us and make a difference! APPLY HERE if you're interested in:**

* Making a big impact in a small company and fast-growing company
* Working and communicating with a smart team of tech professionals
* We’re a small company and your input will carry a lot of weight in getting things done.

**Perks & Benefits**

* A place to grow your skills and career.
* People. Work with a talented, committed, and supportive team.
* Excellent medical, dental and vision benefits.

title: Sage Intacct Implementation Consultant (Bilingual)
description:
**Sage Intacct Implementation Consultant (Bilingual)**  

**Full Time/Permanent**  

**Location: Quebec, CND**  

  

Vision33 is a global IT professional services consultancy that solves customer business challenges through transformative advisory services and technology solutions. We partner with growing organizations in both the public and private sectors to understand their business and help them reach their vision with the right blend of strategy, consulting, and technology. Vision33’s highly skilled, and results-driven team members provide seamless business process and technology expertise across varying industries and client groups.  

  

Vision33 Canada Inc., an award -winning Sage Intacct partner, has been named winner in the Sage Platinum Club for fiscal year 2023.
  

  

Vision33 is currently looking to hire a **Sage** **Intacct Implementation Consultant (Bilingual)** to join our team. If you are looking for an exciting opportunity**, we have a role for you!**  

  

***In this hands-on role, you will be responsible for:***
* Providing consulting, training, and support to deliver successful implementations of native cloud accounting software solutions for customers.
* Working directly with CFO’s, CIO’s and end users to shape solutions that access and report on business information and deliver results that impact corporate performance.
* Performing analysis and systems documentation, creation of financial reports and product configuration and roll out.
* Advising and guiding customers on their journey from system selection to go-live and post implementation support and beyond.
* Supporting internal and external sales efforts as required.


  

***We are seeking candidates that will bring the following skills and experience:***
* Post-secondary education in Finance/Accounting, Business and/or Information Systems.
* Knowledge or direct experience in native cloud accounting/ERP products (eg. Sage Intacct, Netsuite) and industry trends.
* Minimum of 5 years’ industry experience.
* Excellent analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Strong business analysis skills and technology/cloud awareness.
* Ability to effectively manage project deliverables to meet client expectations.
* Superior written and communication skills.
* Experience providing training to customers.
* Commitment to personal continuous learning and creating exceptional customer experiences.


  

We offer a competitive total rewards program including paid vacation and leave, retirement plan, health and wellness programs, training and development, and various other employee benefits and perks. We offer exciting opportunities for diverse project work, internal mobility, global travel, and so much more. If you want to be part of a global, diverse, passionate and fun environment where you can really make a difference; please submit an online application today!  

For more information on our company please visit our web site at www.vision33.ca  

  

  

**Consultant en implantation de Sage Intacct (bilingue)**  

**Temps plein, permanent**  

**Lieu: Québec, CND**  

  

Vision33 est une firme mondiale de services-conseils professionnels en informatique qui résout les défis commerciaux des clients grâce à des services de conseils transformationnels et des solutions technologiques. Nous travaillons en partenariat avec des organisations en croissance dans les secteurs public et privé pour comprendre leur activité et les aider à réaliser leur vision avec la bonne combinaison de stratégie, de conseil et de technologie. Les membres de l’équipe hautement qualifiés et axés sur les résultats de Vision33 fournissent une expertise transparente en matière de processus commerciaux et de technologie dans divers secteurs et groupes de clients.  

Vision33 Canada Inc., un partenaire primé de Sage Intacct, a été nommé gagnant du Sage Platinum Club pour l'exercice 2023.  

  

Vision33 est actuellement à la recherche d'un **consultant en implantation de Sage Intacct (bilingue)** pour rejoindre notre équipe. Si vous recherchez une opportunité passionnante, nous avons un rôle pour vous!  

  

***Dans ce rôle pratique, vous serez responsable de :***
* Fournir des services conseil, de la formation et de l'assistance pour assurer aux clients des déploiements réussies de solutions logicielles de comptabilité en infonuagique.
* Travailler directement avec les directeurs financiers, les directeurs informatiques et les utilisateurs finaux pour façonner des solutions qui accèdent aux informations commerciales, offrent des comptes rendus et fournissent des résultats qui ont un impact sur les performances de l'entreprise.
* Réaliser des analyses et documentations de systèmes, créer des rapports financiers, la configuration et le déploiement de la solution.
* Conseiller et guider les clients dans leur parcours depuis la sélection du système jusqu'à la mise en service et le support post-implémentation et au-delà.
* Soutenir les efforts de vente internes et externes, selon les besoins.


  

***Nous recherchons des candidats qui apporteront les compétences et l'expérience suivantes :***
* Études postsecondaires en finance/comptabilité, commerce et/ou systèmes d'information.
* Connaissance ou expérience directe des produits de comptabilité/ERP cloud natifs (par exemple Sage Intacct, Netsuite) et des tendances du secteur.
* Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience dans l'industrie.
* Excellentes compétences analytiques, de résolution de problèmes et de dépannage.
* Solides compétences en analyse commerciale et connaissance de la technologie/de l’infonuagique.
* Capacité à gérer efficacement les livrables du projet pour répondre aux attentes des clients.
* Compétences supérieures en rédaction et en communication.
* Expérience en prestation de formation aux clients.
* Engagement envers l'apprentissage continu personnel et la création d'expériences client exceptionnelles.


  

Nous proposons un programme de récompense globale compétitif comprenant des vacances et des congés payés, un plan de retraite, des programmes de santé et de bien-être, de la formation et du développement, ainsi que divers autres avantages sociaux et avantages pour les employés. Nous offrons des opportunités passionnantes pour des projets diversifiés, de la mobilité interne, des voyages internationaux et bien plus encore. Si vous souhaitez faire partie d'un environnement mondial, diversifié, passionné et amusant dans lequel vous pouvez vraiment faire la différence ; veuillez soumettre une candidature en ligne dès aujourd'hui!  

  

Pour plus d'informations sur notre entreprise, veuillez visiter notre site Web à www.vision33.ca

title: Responsable des opérations / Operations Manager
description:
**À propos d'Oxia**

Oxia Initiative est une start-up dynamique dont la mission est d’automatiser l'impact carbone des entreprises et de déployer efficacement des capitaux vers des solutions à faibles émissions de carbone. Nos outils innovants offrent transparence et standardisation, permettant aux gestionnaires de fonds, aux entreprises et aux gouvernements de mesurer l'impact carbone de leur portefeuille et d'allouer les financements verts de la manière la plus efficace pour le bien-être de notre planète.

**À propos de vous**

Nous cherchons à renforcer notre équipe avec une personne créative partageant nos valeurs en matière de développement durable. Le titulaire du poste aura l'opportunité de mettre en place des mécanismes d’optimisation des processus administratifs pour veiller au maintien d’une saine gouvernance. En tant que responsable des opérations, vous superviserez les opérations quotidiennes en veillant à l’alignement sur nos objectifs stratégiques. Votre rôle englobera la supervision des finances, des ressources humaines, du développement de produits et du service client, travaillant à rationaliser les processus, améliorer l'efficacité et contribuer à la réalisation de la vision de notre entreprise.

**Responsabilités**

Comptabilité et Finances

* Superviser et coordonner les fonctions comptables, garantissant délais et précision.
* Mettre à jour le plan comptable Oxia en collaboration avec le comptable.
* Suivre la mise en place du système ERP pour la filiale française selon les normes IFRS.

Facturation et Paiements

* Préparer et envoyer les factures aux clients, suivre les revenus récurrents et les paiements.
* Mettre en place la reconnaissance des revenus en 2024 et automatiser le processus de facturation.

Gestion Bancaire

* Gérer les transactions de paiement et les activités bancaires, incluant les factures récurrentes et les virements.
* Suivre les dépenses, traiter les factures à payer, et assurer le remboursement des subventions gouvernementales.
* Effectuer des transferts internationaux pour les fournisseurs ou consultants.

Audit Mensuel et Rapports Financiers

* Effectuer les conciliations bancaires, surveiller les frais, transactions, dettes, et mettre à jour la trésorerie.
* S'assurer du dépôt en temps voulu de la TPS/TVQ, produire les déclarations de revenus et les états financiers.

Gestion de Projets

* Superviser le respect des échéances pour la conception, le développement et le lancement des produits.
* Gérer les conflits de livrables, coordonner les projets, et assurer la précision et le respect des délais.

Ressources Humaines

* Gérer la paie, soutenir le recrutement, et coordonner les subventions salariales.
* Superviser les stages, maintenir la confidentialité et mettre en place le processus pour la filiale française.

**Qualifications**

* Diplôme universitaire en administration, finance, comptabilité, gestion ou tout autre domaine pertinent.
* Minimum cinq ans d'expérience dans des rôles similaires.
* Leadership mobilisateur axé sur l’intégrité.
* Maîtrise des processus de planification stratégique.
* Capacité à diagnostiquer rapidement les problèmes et à anticiper les répercussions.
* Esprit de synthèse et expérience en rédaction de subventions.
* Agilité positive face à l'incertitude.
* Capacité à travailler de manière indépendante et au sein d'une équipe à distance.

**Conditions**

Rejoignez une équipe jeune, dynamique et interculturelle.

Faites partie du changement de paradigme, co-créez le monde de demain.

Menez des projets qui génèrent des retours écologiques et économiques bénéfiques.

* Poste permanent à temps plein (37,5 heures par semaine)
* Grande flexibilité d’horaire (de jour, du lundi au vendredi)
* 100% en télétravail
* Ordinateur et équipement de bureau fournit
* Salaire selon l’expérience
* Culture d’entreprise basée sur le dépassement de soi, l’apprentissage et l’impact
* Entrée en fonction : Aussitôt que possible

\\*\\*\\*\\*

**About Oxia**

Oxia Initiative’s mission is to empower decision makers to measure carbon impact and to effectively deploy capital towards low-carbon solutions. Our innovative tools provide transparency and standardization that allows fund managers, companies and governments to measure both the positive and negative carbon impact of their portfolio and allocate green funding in the most efficient way for the wellbeing of our planet.

**About you**

We are looking to strengthen our team with a creative person, comfortable in a dynamic startup and sharing our values in sustainable development. The job holder will have the opportunity to establish mechanisms for optimizing administrative processes to ensure the maintenance of healthy governance. As the operations manager, you will drive the seamless day-to-day operations of our company, ensuring departments function optimally and align with our strategic goals. Your role encompasses overseeing Finance, HR, Product Development, and Customer Service, working to streamline processes, enhance efficiency, and contribute to the achievement of our company's vision.

**Responsibilities**

Accounting and Finance

* Supervise and coordinate accounting functions, ensuring deadlines and accuracy.
* Update the Oxia chart of accounts in collaboration with the accountant.
* Monitor the implementation of the ERP system for the French subsidiary according to IFRS standards.

Invoicing and Payments

* Prepare and send invoices to clients, monitor recurring revenue, and payments.
* Implement revenue recognition in 2024 and automate the billing process.

Bank Management

* Manage payment transactions and banking activities, including recurring invoices and transfers.
* Monitor expenses, process payable invoices, and ensure government grant reimbursements.
* Conduct international transfers for suppliers or consultants.

Monthly Audit and Financial Reports

* Perform bank reconciliations, monitor fees, transactions, debts, and update cash flow.
* Ensure timely filing of GST/QST, produce income statements, and financial statements.

Project Management

* Supervise adherence to deadlines for product design, development, and launch.
* Manage deliverable conflicts, coordinate projects, and ensure accuracy and deadline compliance.

Human Resources

* Manage payroll, support recruitment, and coordinate wage subsidies.
* Supervise internships, maintain confidentiality, and implement processes for the French subsidiary.

Qualifications

* University degree in administration, finance, accounting, management, or any other relevant field.
* Minimum five years of experience in similar roles.
* Inspirational leadership focused on integrity.
* Mastery of strategic planning processes.
* Ability to quickly diagnose problems and anticipate repercussions.
* Analytical mindset and experience in grant writing.
* Positive agility in the face of uncertainty.
* Ability to work independently and within a remote team.

**Conditions**

Join a young, dynamic, and intercultural team.

Be part of a paradigm shift, co-create the world of tomorrow.

Lead projects that generate environmentally and economically beneficial returns.

* Permanent full-time position (37.5 hours per week)
* Flexible schedule (daytime, Monday to Friday)
* 100% remote work
* Salary commensurate with experience
* Computer and office equipment provided
* Company culture based on self-improvement, learning, and impact
* Start date: As soon as possible

Date limite de candidature : 2024-02-29

Type d'emploi : Temps Plein, Permanent

Salaire : 22,00$ à 30,00$ par heure

Heures prévues : 37.5 par semaine

Avantages :

* Heures d’arrivée et de départ flexibles
* Options d'Achats d'Actions
* Travail à domicile

Horaires de travail :

* Du Lundi au Vendredi
* Quart de jour

Question(s) de présélection:

* Are you legally eligible to work in Canada? Do you currently possess the necessary status or permits required to work in Canada?

Êtes-vous légalement autorisé à travailler au Canada ? Possédez-vous actuellement le statut ou les permis nécessaires pour travailler au Canada ?

Expérience:

* gestion: 5 ans (Souhaité)

Langue:

* Anglais (Obligatoire)
* Français (Obligatoire)

Lieu du poste : Télétravail

Date limite de candidature : 2024-02-29

title: SC Performance Improvement – Lead Consultant
description:
**SC Performance Improvement – Lead Consultant**

**JOB SUMMARY:**


Argano, a premier supply chain management integrator delivering outcomes that transform companies has just created a seat at the table for a remarkable Supply Chain Performance Improvement Manager. Reporting into one of our Performance Improvement Community of Practice leads, you will join a team that has been guiding major transformation initiatives and critical projects for our clients. You can be located near any major city in US or Canada.


The Argano Supply Chain Performance Improvement practice helps organizations analyze and improve their supply chains. From a long-term strategy determining where to place operating locations; identifying the best areas for capital investment; delivering to a specific customer on time in full, we explore methods for maximizing performance at every stage in the process.


**Responsibilities:**


* Work closely with the Engagement or Project Manager to review the high-level plans developed during the sales process to build the detailed workplans and the inventory of required deliverables needed to deliver the required outcomes for our clients.
* Leverage our LIFT delivery methodology and past project key learnings while building the required plan which uniquely fits the client situation.
* Establish a strong working relationship with the client business leaders and project sponsors.
* Work with Argano’s clients to lead the implementation of end-to-end planning processes across the horizons including Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) and Sales & Operations Execution (S&OE).
* Be able to help clients understand how to integrate plans across different horizons.
* Manage client blueprint and design sessions to create seamless solutions within a client’s SCM environment.
* Lead Supply Chain and Decision Analysis to identify and size improvement opportunities in client’s supply chain planning, logistics and distribution networks.
* Lead / Guide Statistical Analysis, Basic Accounting, Supply Chain Optimization/modeling to seize opportunities for client investment.
* Utilize BI/BW or similar analytics programming tools & concepts to develop solutions for clients.
* Consult client on their effective usage of ERP systems (particularly SAP) and adjacent systems.
* Be prepared to work across one or more projects (at one or more clients).
* Actively participate in the development and refinement of our Performance Improvement methods, tools, and capabilities.
* Lead/champion a specific set of Performance Improvement leading practice capabilities teaching & training the rest of our community of practice how to best deploy when needed.


**Minimum and/or Preferred Qualifications:**

EDUCATION:


* Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management-related field preferred or equivalent experience


EXPERIENCE:


* Participation or leadership of S&OP process;
* Knowledge and demonstrated results in the Supply Chain areas: network optimization, warehouse management, inventory management, transportation, and logistics optimization;
* Understanding and application of cost-to-serve concept and how it impacts profitability;
* 5 to 10 years of experience in supply chain planning or supply chain execution.


SKILL REQUIREMENTS – provide the most relevant skills & competencies for the level of role – see examples below


* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Demonstrated high proficiency in excel advanced functions
* Demonstrated high proficiency in word and power point
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Demonstrated mathematical skills and the ability to interpret/analyze complex data to develop recommendations and solutions
* Self-starter, able to research a topic and offer a solution
* Strong understanding of processes and data


The base compensation range for this position is $110,000 - $155,000 commensurate with experience. Argano also offers a performance-based bonus and strong benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Parental Leave and Flexible Time Off.

title: Professional Services Implementation Consultant
description:
**Why Springbrook:**


Springbrook Software is the leader in cloud-based ERP and payments software for local municipal governments and special districts. For over 30 years, Springbrook has set the industry standard for how small and medium sized municipalities and utility districts operate with high efficiency, economy, and security. More than 2,000 cities, towns, and districts from coast to coast use our suite of modern, high-performance solutions to manage their finances, payroll, and utility billing. We believe in a citizen-centric government that empowers its community with financial transparency, efficiency, and a seamless payment experience.
  

  

We offer employees a culture that emphasizes performance, productivity, and collaboration. You will be empowered and engaged working with like-minded individuals who are driven and passionate about contributing to a market-leading software organization with proven technology.
  

  

While we are busy changing the world, we also strongly believe in having fun and excitement at work as well as encourage a collaborative and healthy work-life balance. We also offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits.  

  

If you are motivated by the idea of delivering on the promise of solving for a new era of more efficient, open, and innovative governance, then we'd love to hear from you.

**Where You Fit:**


The Professional Services department at Springbrook is looking for an Implementation Consultant to assist with implementing Springbrook's cloud ERP software in local governments throughout the country. You'll work alongside our team of project managers and consultants to help configure, train, and provide go live support to our newest customers. This position offers the flexibility for you to work from any location within the United States, including out of your home office or one of the several Springbrook offices throughout the country.


This opportunity is for remote work, occasional travel maybe required.

**Responsibilities:**

* Interview customers and gather and document requirements for planning how best to configure Springbrook's software
* Review converted data to ensure complete and accurate information is brought forward into our software
* Configure Springbrook's software in a manner consistent with the customer's business practices
* Provide end-user training in our software
* Provide go live support and ensure a seamless transition of the customer account to Springbrook's Customer Support department
* Occasional travel to customer sites on occasion to perform software implementation work and training may be required.
* Maintain general awareness of Springbrook security and privacy policies
* Report any security incident or suspected security incident to the Springbrook Incident Response Team
* Maintain general awareness of Springbrook security and privacy policies
* Report any security incident or suspected security incident to the Springbrook Incident Response Team

**Required Qualifications:**

* 3+ years experience in a role that that is customer-facing (e.g., Professional Services, Customer Support, Customer Success, etc.)
* Bachelor's degree in finance or business related or an additional 2 years experience in a SaaS implementation position
* Proficiency in using complex software, including SaaS-based solutions
* Experience in tracking and meeting billable utilization targets
* Experience in implementing either Financial software, Utility Billing (UB) software or Payments Software.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Prior experience working in a municipal government, water billing, or electric billing agency
* Prior experience working with municipal finance and billing and payment software
* Prior experience working with ERP software and tools (SAP, Salesforce, Sage/Intaact, NetSuite, etc.)


*Applicants must have the unrestricted ability to work in the United States (sponsorship will not be offered)*

*Springbrook Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Springbrook does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran* *status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.*

title: Package Consultant Oracle ERP Cloud Functional Lead
description:
Job Description

We are looking for an experienced Oracle ERP Cloud Functional Lead with expertise in General Ledger, Account Receivables, and Account Payables modules. Note: This is 100% Remote role with 30% - 40% travel - expenses are paid.

Skill / Qualifications

* Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 8+ years of experience as an Oracle ERP Cloud Functional Lead.
* Expertise in Oracle ERP Cloud modules, specifically General Ledger, Account Receivables, and Account Payables.
* Strong leadership skills to lead sprint calls and guide project teams.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Flexibility to work collaboratively with India Offshore teams.
* In-depth knowledge of Oracle ERP functionalities and configuration.
* Experience in Cash Management and Projects modules within Oracle ERP Cloud is a plus.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to adapt to changing project requirements and timelines.
* Solid understanding of financial business processes.

Job Responsibilities

* **Oracle ERP Cloud Functional Leadership:**
* Lead and guide the implementation of Oracle ERP Cloud functionalities, specifically in General Ledger, Account Receivables, and Account Payables.
* Provide subject matter expertise to the project team and clients.
* **Client Interaction:**
* Lead sprint calls with clients to understand requirements, provide updates, and address any issues or concerns.
* Ensure a strong client relationship by delivering high-quality solutions and maintaining effective communication.
* **Collaboration with Offshore Team:**
* Collaborate effectively with the India Offshore team, providing guidance, support, and ensuring seamless coordination.
* Conduct regular meetings to align project objectives and expectations.
* **Oracle ERP Configuration:**
* Hands-on configuration of Oracle ERP Cloud modules, ensuring alignment with business processes and client requirements.
* Provide technical leadership and expertise in solving configuration challenges.
* **Functional Design Documentation:**
* Create in-depth functional design documentation, outlining the configuration details, workflows, and integration points.
* Ensure documentation accuracy and relevance throughout the project lifecycle.
* **Knowledge of Additional Modules:**
* Demonstrate knowledge of Cash Management and Projects modules within Oracle ERP Cloud.
* Collaborate with relevant teams to integrate these modules effectively.
* **Continuous Learning:**
* Stay updated on the most recent Oracle ERP functionalities, features, and best practices.
* Share knowledge with the team and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.

Benefits

Competitive Hourly Rate (Depending on Experience)

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

* General Ledger: 8 years (Preferred)
* Accounts receivable: 8 years (Preferred)
* Accounts payable: 8 years (Preferred)
* ERP configuration: 8 years (Preferred)
* Cash management: 8 years (Preferred)

title: Process Improvement/ERP Consultant
description:
Description:
**FOR FULL JOB ANNOUNCEMENT PLEASE REFER TO GFOA JOB BOARD**

  

Consultants within GFOA’s Research and Consulting Center (RCC) provide direct support for a variety of GFOA programs including consulting engagements, training seminars, best practice research, member networking, program administration and more. Consultant/Analysts become subject matter experts in enterprise resource planning (ERP) procurement and implementation, risk management, budgeting, and other RCC core competency areas to support GFOA clients across the United States and Canada. Working in small teams, consultant/analysts help analyze local government business process, evaluate options, provide recommendations, and maintain GFOA know-how to support GFOA’s consulting practice. Other projects for Consultant/Analyst may include serving as subject matter expert to lead research projects or coordinate training opportunities, promote GFOA’s membership, lead programming related to specific topics or target market segments, or provide data analysis or staff support across the organization. Consultant/Analysts are expected to manage competing priorities and deadlines, work independently, demonstrate knowledge and appreciation for local governments, advocate for GFOA best practices and support of GFOA’s mission to advance excellence in public finance.


Consultant/Analysts work from GFOA’s Chicago office with hybrid work from home options and travel approximately 7-10 days per month.

**Responsiblities**
-------------------

* Staff GFOA’s consulting projects providing direct support, working independently, to local governments interested in preparing for, procuring, and implementing enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems
* Facilitate focus group meetings with GFOA clients to identify process improvement opportunities
* Review ERP proposals, interview consultants, review work products, and participate in ERP implementation for local governments
* Manage several “mini-projects” ensuring project organization, communication, and outcomes
* Facilitate GFOA networking groups both online and in person.
* Regularly present information and/or recommendations at meetings with clients, members, or staff
* Produce high quality reports and consulting deliverables that leverage communication and data presentation skills


Requirements:**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------

* Graduate degree in public policy, public administration or related field and prefer 3-5 years of working in public finance or local government administration
* Ability to lead small teams and oversee creation of work products
* Prefer subject matter expertise in any of the following: budgeting, treasury, risk, capital planning, procurement, or other topic areas in public finance.
* Ability to apply GFOA best practices, research findings, and case studies to develop recommendations for local governments
* Prefer knowledge and experience with ERP systems
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Self-motivated and ability to work through ambiguity
* Ability to collaborate with other staff on multiple priorities to meet both internal and external deadlines

title: IT Consultant
description:
**IT Consultant**  

**Full Time / Permanent**  

**Location: Dartmouth, NS**  

  

**Be part of a transformation and global expansion with Vision33!**  

  

Vision33 is a global IT professional services consultancy that solves customer business challenges through the promise of technology. We do this by providing the right software, services, and support to break down barriers and transform businesses.  

  

We are one of Canada’s top Sage and SAP Partners and our customers are backed by a robust Managed IT Services practice through our iSupport solution, growing their competitive advantage. We form trusted and long-term relationships with clients, driving business value through innovation and productivity.  

  

Our people are empowered to do the right thing in service of our clients. Sound interesting? Want to be a part of it? We are currently seeking an IT Consultant to join our team in Dartmouth, NS.  

  

***In this hands-on role, you will be responsible for:***
* Providing day-to-day IT support for a large and diverse client base remotely and via site visits.
* Working directly with clients to gather and document requirements relating to their internal systems, networks, and applications.
* Designing optimal technical solutions to meet client requirements and specifications.
* Responding to service requests in designated response time and maintaining records in our ticketing system.
* Working closely with team members to resolve client issues and requests.
* Supporting internal and external sales efforts as required.
* Rigorously following existing procedures and best practices, as well as contributing to the development and refinement of such procedures.


  

***We are seeking candidates that will bring the following skills and experience:***
* Relevant post-secondary education is an asset, coupled with 3-5 years of complementary experience.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to take action and execute.
* Knowledge of IT infrastructure in the small/medium business space including Active Directory permissions, security, desktops, firewalls, and peripheral equipment such as printers and mobile devices.
* Knowledge of cloud-based offerings from industry leaders such as Microsoft 365.
* Knowledge of Windows Server, desktop, and VMware virtualized server environments.
* Familiarity with SAP B1 or any other ERP software would be an asset.
* Excellent verbal communication skills and listening skills in order to correspond with clients, diagnose issues, resolve problems, and correspond with team players.
* Experience using and managing remote monitoring and alerting systems.


  

We offer a competitive total rewards program including, paid vacation and leaves, retirement plan, health and wellness programs, training and development, and various other employee benefits and perks. We offer exciting opportunities for diverse project work, internal mobility, global travel, and so much more. If you want to be part of a global, diverse, passionate, and fun environment where you can really make a difference; please submit an online application today!  

  

For more information on our company please visit our web site at www.vision33.ca

title: Oracle Cloud ERP - Lead Technical Consultant
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**


A Lead Technical Consultant at Argano is a seasoned member of the Technical Consulting team with deep technical expertise. They are responsible for leading and managing mid to large-scale software projects using Argano’s professional services and solutions. They have a deep understanding of software development and often serve as technical experts within the company. This person will provide technical leadership for the Argano Oracle Cloud consulting practice. The Senior Oracle Cloud Technical Lead will integrate and extend Oracle Cloud SaaS solutions using Platform as a Service (PaaS) offerings such as Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC) and Oracle Database Cloud Service (DBCS). Their responsibilities include writing code, analyzing data, and contributing to the design and implementation of software. A Lead Technical Consultant leads the analysis/design phase of the system development life cycle to develop user requirements and determines best business/technical solutions to meet those needs ensuring the ability to meet users’ implementation time frames.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Lead and manage mid to large scale software development projects.
* Provides technical development leadership in strategic Oracle Cloud projects.
* Continuously pursues advanced level technical acumen.
* Provides Oracle Cloud development thought leadership and expertise.
* Produces technology roadmaps in support of Argano vision and strategy.
* Develops proof-of-concept prototypes and initial implementation models.
* Monitors implementation activity to ensure architecture and design principles are upheld.
* Ensures implementation solutions support architecture objectives (availability, scalability, performance, security, etc.), as appropriate.
* Utilizes advanced leadership skills especially in the areas of persuasion, influence, conceptualizing solutions and problem solving.
* Communicates complicated technical concepts effectively to a broad group of stakeholders.
* Coaches and mentors Cloud Technical team members.
* Utilizes a general understanding of the competitive landscape and corporate and business unit strategies to provide context for development decision making.
* Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.
* Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise.
* Design and implement solutions, gather, and analyze requirements with business owner and organize discussion and infrastructure requirement analysis to meet the defined business criteria.
* Evaluate and introduce new technologies.
* Design and develop applications, including the taxonomy of site structure.
* Administer user groups and design, including creating users and user groups and allocate required permissions.
* Meeting with project managers to determine CRM needs, developing customized solutions within the Technology platform, Designing, coding, and implementing applications.
* Creating timelines and development goals.


**MINIMUM AND/OR PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**


**EDUCATION****:**


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, Information Technology or related field.
* Relevant coursework or certifications in programming or software development.
* Master’s degree or PhD in computer science or software engineering preferred.


**EXPERIENCE****:**


* 5 - 10 years of technical consultant experience for IT companies or in related field.
* Oracle Cloud Software as a Service (SaaS) Technical Development
* Oracle Platform as a Service (PaaS) with a focus on Integration Cloud Service, Java Cloud Service, Database Cloud Service
* Experience with integration development using Oracle Middleware solutions such as SOA Suite / Fusion Middleware.
* Experience Extending Oracle SaaS footprints with PaaS (Creating custom applications in JCS or similar environment and integrating with Oracle Cloud Applications.)
* Experience with Oracle Identity Manager, LDAP, MS Active Directory and identity propagation
* Experience as solution architect / lead role in at least two full life cycle Oracle Cloud applications /On premise implementations
* Expertise with Web Services and the use of Oracle Cloud delivered Web Services (SOAP & REST).
* Experience with Oracle Cloud data conversion
* Experience with Oracle Cloud SaaS Security
* Technical skills in the creation of BI Publisher Reports; FRS (financial reporting studio) Reports and OTBI (Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence) reports
* Functional concepts and understanding of all Oracle applications.
* IT Professional with a Bachelor’s Degree in a technology-related field, with 8+ years of experience of Oracle ERP implementations.
* Experience developing customer-facing interfaces.
* Advanced knowledge of programming languages.
* Experience creating and maintaining databases.
* Experience working with Agile development technologies.
* Advanced project management skills.
* Experience managing multiple projects for different clients.

  

  

**SKILL REQUIREMENTS**


* **Problem-Solving:** Exceptional problem-solving skills for complex technical challenges.
* **Leadership**: Project leadership and management skills, including the ability to set technology goals
* **Innovation**: Ability to drive innovation and research efforts.
* **Communication**: Excellent communication and teamwork skills, including the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
* **Strategic Thinking:** Strategic thinking to align technology with business goals.
* **Expertise**: Exceptional expertise in various programming languages, frameworks, and technologies.
* **Software Architecture:** Deep understanding of software architecture, design, and best practices.


The base compensation range for this position is $150,000 - $175,000 commensurate with experience. Argano also offers a performance-based bonus and strong benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Parental Leave and Flexible Time Off.

title: Senior NetSuite Consultant
description:
**Sky High ERP** is currently seeking a **Technical NetSuite Consultant** to join our **remote team**.

  

Come be a part of a **young, pioneering****,** **and rapidly growing company** that cares about your **career advancement**.

  


**Sky High** is a NetSuite professional services firm that specializes in **NetSuite ERP consulting.** Our mission is to bring happiness into the workplace. With both clients and employees. We achieve this by bringing our customers into the digital era by utilizing our comprehensive techno-functional skillsets to optimize and streamline business processes within our client’s ERP system.


.

  


**Qualifications for Technical NetSuite Consultant role:**


* Graduated with a **bachelor’s degree** in Business, Finance, Computer Science, Accounting, Information Technology, or a related field
* At least **3** **years of NetSuite experience** or another ERP software solution experience
* Expertise in multiple NetSuite modules
* **Strong background in software development**, consulting and advisory services, general vertical-specific industry experience
* Experienced in other development areas including **JavaScript****,** **SuiteScript****,** **(1.0, 2.x),** **SuiteFlow****,** **integration development, web development**, and/or complex custom integrations in NetSuite
* Experience with **Boomi,** **Celigo****, or similar iPaaS solutions**
* Excellent **written and verbal communication skills**
* Strong **team** **and customer skills**
* **Comfortable working in a client facing role** with both technical and functional stakeholders
* A thorough **understanding of software development best practices**

  


**Additional Assets:**


* Multiple **full cycle NetSuite implementations**
* Excellent **presentation skills**
* NetSuite certifications are a plus (E.g. **SuiteFoundation, NetSuite Certified** **Administrator and****NetSuite** **SuiteCloud** **Developer)**
* French as an asset

  


**Essential Duties for Technical NetSuite Consultant role:**


* Provide technical expertise utilizing industry-leading best practices, and a pragmatic mindset to facilitate clients' most complex requirements.
* Conduct requirements gathering sessions with clients to determine configuration requirements both on-site and remote.
* Implement and deploy NetSuite solutions accommodating unique industry, business, and management processes, regulatory requirements, and other business requirements
* Integrate a variety of 3rd party applications using a range of tools and code to achieve the best results
* Actively participate in multiple engagements, interacting directly with clients and senior members of the team throughout implementations
* Troubleshoot issues that arise during configuration sessions
* Provide ongoing post-implementation support to optimize user adoption and NetSuite configuration
* Configuration and customization of our customer’s NetSuite instances
* Work in collaboration with the team to coordinate efforts and remediate the highest priority gaps
* Using your in depth knowledge of NetSuite and expanded application options, learn the existing internal technology stack and recommend possible solutions for efficiencies
* Coaching junior resources
* Dispatch and oversee tasks for junior resources
* Perform quality control for customizations and integrations

  


**Perks at Sky High:**



Here are some of **the outstanding benefits** that you will enjoy when you become a part of our growing team:


* **Competitive Salary** based on experience.
* **Work remotely** from anywhere in Canada
* Vibrant monthly **social events**
* Benefit from our 50/50 **group insurance** after just three months
* We see your effort and we want to reward you; **Performance** **bonuses**
* Work hard, Play Harder; **Enjoy 3** **weeks vacation** **& 4 personal/sick** **days** **+ Boxing day off**
* Prioritize your health with **Dialogue, Canada’s leading virtual care provider**, available to you from day one.
* Commitment to a healthy **work-life balance**
* The opportunity to work with a **stellar team** and grow in your career.

  



We cordially await your application!



Don’t hesitate to contact us if you have any further questions.

  


**Hesitant? This is why you should join us at Sky High!**

  

Here at Sky High, we are learning something new every day. Each day, we wake up to a new challenge, no day is the same as the next. This is the **ideal environment** to improve your functional, technical, and soft skills while in a **rapidly growing and supportive** environment. Together, **as a team, we can get through anything.** By joining Sky High, you will learn the skills currently in high demand in our market. You will work alongside a small team of **talented consultants** who aim to make a difference in their customer’s daily life. In this team, **your voice matters,** because **at Sky High ERP, we care.** We place h**igh esteem on our customers and equally, our employees**. As their satisfaction will ensure the bright future of Sky High.

title: Senior Business Analyst - Healthcare
description:
**WHO WE ARE:**  

Mariner innovates always and everywhere, turning novel ideas into practical solutions. From products and services to venture creation, we build better futures powered by people. Our purpose has always been to be a great, everlasting technology company for those who make an impact - elevating people, data, and technology in the best way to solve hard problems. We partner with people embracing change, leveraging data, cybersecurity, cloud, and change management to drive successful business outcomes that matter to our customers.
  
  

Mariners build for change. Like SHIFT Energy, our energy management and decarbonization company. Or East Valley created to scale social economic impact in our communities through investment and mentorship of emerging change-makers and their companies.
  
  

Mariner’s purpose has always been to be a great, everlasting technology company and the core values that guide us every day are:
  
  

OUR VALUES
  
  

* We care for our team.
* We care about the impact we have on our community.
* We serve by solving complex problems.
* We grow because growth fuels opportunities.
* We innovate always and everywhere.
* We build a business that lasts.


**OVERVIEW OF THE ROLE:**  

To help in our planned growth, we are pro-actively recruiting for Business Analysts with Healthcare experience for upcoming full-time and contract opportunities for our clients in Nova Scotia and New Brunswick. The Senior Business Analyst will be a key member of our IT Professional Services team. In this role, you will be responsible for client-based projects and, in collaboration with our delivery and sales teams, you will deliver best of breed solutions to new and existing customers.
  
  

**WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING IN THE ROLE:**  

* Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements
* Documentation of current and future state process mapping
* Prepare Business Requirements Documents, including functional/non-functional requirements
* Collaborate in the development of test plans and test cases
* define reporting and alerting requirements
* Prepare integration plans for deployment of system changes into existing environments
* Help design, document and maintain system processes
* Change and support process management for new technology delivery
* Facilitate stakeholder sessions, interviews, and analysis to identify areas for process and systems improvement
* Communicate key insights and findings to client team


**WHAT SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS YOU’LL NEED TO DO THE JOB:**  

* Post-secondary education in business, computer science, or a related field from a recognized institution
* 6+ years of progressive corporate experience functioning as an IT Business Analyst/Functional Analyst
* CBAP certification or willing to obtain
* Demonstrated success with business requirements analysis, group facilitation, gap analysis and process mapping and design as part of a business transformation.
* Experience in working in a formal systems development lifecycle methodology environment involving such artifacts as functional and detail design documents, business use cases, and requirements traceability
* Demonstrated skill in building consensus among process stakeholders
* Exceptional communication skills and experience in working with business experts at all levels and technical subject matter experts
* Experience working in client-based consulting role is highly desirable Specific reference-able project experience in one or more of the following areas highly desirable: data management, analytics, asset management, GIS, data center, AMI, ERP, CRM
* Experience in Public sector/Government is an asset


…AND YOU ARE...
  
  

* Always improving your skills and knowledge: you want to be the best at what you do
* Curious and creative; comfortable taking on new problems and challenges
* A self-starter with the ability to recommend priorities to the project leader
* Comfortable working through problems and figuring things out with minimal supervision
* Great problem-solving skills: thorough and reliable
* Able to work in a team: share knowledge and assist other team members
* A good communicator: able to explain your ideas and recommendations
* Well organized and dependable under pressure: you manage your time effectively
* Energized by our company values!


**MARINER OFFERS YOU:**  

* A values-driven workplace where people really matter
* Flexible work location support for remote work/work from home. Some on-site work may be required.
* Competitive salary, retirement savings program, and rewards program
* Comprehensive health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance plans and access to e-health care
* Paid vacation, maternity/parental leave, paid sick leave and paid Mariner MyLife days
* Unlimited training


WHY MARINER?
  
  

We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work! Not only are we passionate about nurturing a thriving technology sector here in Atlantic Canada, but we are also committed to solving technology challenges that will make an impact worldwide. Technology is everlasting, and we take pride in connecting world class talent to world class projects and business solutions.
  
  

If you are an IT Professional, Software Professional, or Management Consultant, that is passionate about career development, data, and problem solving, we want to hear from you! If this sounds like someone you know, share this with them so they do not miss the opportunity to experience Mariner!
  
  

To achieve this, we know we need to be all in on training and development of our team so we can continue to move the needle in the technology sector together. Of course, we offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to our team, but our competitive edge is the development and training that our team experiences every day.
  
  

Be part of our vibrant community that values diversity and embraces inclusion at every level. We are committed to fostering a culture where individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life feel empowered to contribute their unique perspectives. Our collaborative environment celebrates the richness of ideas and experiences, and we believe that by embracing diversity, we can achieve greater innovation and excellence together. Come and help us create a workplace that reflects the beautiful tapestry of our global community.
  
  

Join our growing team!

title: Consultant Testeur de Logiciels Junior / Quality Assurance Analyst Junior Consultant
description:
**SOLJIT en bref**


SOLJIT (compagnie Levio - www.soljit.com) est un partenaire stratégique qui accompagne et accélère ses clients dans la réalisation de leur vision stratégique et de leur transformation numérique. En tant que partenaire #Salesforce de niveau Summit, nos équipes disposent d’une expérience d’affaires et d’une expertise technique permettant d’accélérer tout type d’entreprises, institutions et OBNL, pour un grand nombre d’industries et de livrer le maximum de valeur à chaque client. Enfin, notre culture et notre approche humaine permettent aux entreprises d’être accompagnées par un partenaire de confiance, avec une vision holistique.

**Missions**


Dans le cadre de votre mission, vous êtes responsable des tests et de la qualité des solutions cloud Salesforce (#sales #cloud, service cloud, #pardot, #marketing cloud, CPQ, communities) destinés aux clients de l’entreprise. Pour cela, vous :

* Préparez les procédures de tests
* Exécutez les #tests
* Réalisez les tests de régression
* Réalisez la documentation des tests
* Gérez les mises en production des projets clients
* Contribuez à faire évoluer les bonnes pratiques et les processus de l'entreprise dans votre domaine

**Requis**

* OBLIGATOIRE: Basé en #Algérie
* OBLIGATOIRE: Pour avoir du succès dans ce rôle, le bilinguisme (#Français et #Anglais) est nécessaire en raison de la nature des activités, nécessitant des interactions avec certains partenaires/clients locaux, nationaux et mondiaux.
* OBLIGATOIRE: Diplômé en #Informatique, Génie informatique, Informatique de gestion ou équivalent
* OBLIGATOIRE: Aptitudes avancées dans le lancement de produits logiciels/cloud de qualité dans les échéanciers prévus en gérant les risques
* Grande expérience dans les meilleures pratiques de tests (#TDD, #BDD)
* Expérience en #CRM, #ERP, transformation numérique est un plus.
* Expérience avec la plateforme Salesforce serait un atout.

**Pourquoi travailler avec SOLJIT?**

* Culture #We Care We Lead We Deliver : culture d’entraide, de bienveillance, d’équilibre travail/famille, d’amélioration continue et de haute qualité du travail.
* Entreprise en forte croissance avec son dynamisme et ses défis (50% de croissance dans les 3 dernières années).
* Travailler avec le CRM numéro 1 au monde (Salesforce) et pour la seule entreprise québécoise étant partenaire SUMMIT avec Salesforce, le plus haut niveau de partenariat possible.
* Travailler pour un partenaire de confiance qui transforme la vie professionnelle de leurs clients en les aidant à se démarquer de la concurrence et à améliorer leur performance ainsi que leur confort de travail. Nos #clients nous donnent d’ailleurs une note de 5/5 sur leur taux de satisfaction sur le Salesforce #AppExchange.
* Des projets stimulants et ambitieux et des opportunités pour développer vos compétences et diversifier vos missions selon vos compétences;
* Intégration et formation garantie grâce à notre #Université #SOLJIT
* Honoraires compétitifs basés sur les compétences et l’expérience.

**Étapes du processus de sélection :**

* entretien téléphonique;
* test psychométrique;
* 1er entretien (en visioconférence);
* test technique +code review avec responsables techniques;
* Offre : Une offre sera faite au candidat retenu, et la date de début du contrat sera confirmée.

**Date de début du contrat :** avril 2024

 **Introduction to SOLJIT**


SOLJIT (#Levio company - www.soljit.com) is a strategic partner that supports and accelerates customers in the realization of their strategic vision and digital transformation. As a Summit-level #Salesforce partner, our teams have the business experience and technical expertise to accelerate all types of companies, institutions and NPOs, across a wide range of industries, and deliver maximum value to every customer. Finally, our culture and human approach enable companies to be accompanied by a trusted partner with a holistic vision.

**Missions**


In your role, you will be responsible for the #testing and quality of Salesforce cloud solutions (#sales cloud, service cloud, pardot, marketing cloud, CPQ, communities) for the company's customers. To do this, you will:

* Prepare test procedures
* Execute the #tests
* Carry out #regression tests
* Realize the documentation of the tests
* Manage the production of customer projects
* Contribute to the evolution of the best practices and processes of the company in your domain

 **Requirements**

* MANDATORY: Based in #Algeria
* MANDATORY: To be successful in this role, bilingualism (#French and #English) is necessary due to the nature of the business, requiring interactions with some local, national and global partners/clients.
* MANDATORY: Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Business Information Systems
* MANDATORY: Advanced skills in launching quality software/cloud products on schedule while managing risk
* Extensive experience in testing best practices (#TDD, #BDD)
* Experience in #CRM, #ERP, digital transformation is a plus.
* Experience with the #Salesforce platform would be a plus.

**Why work with SOLJIT?**

* Culture #We Care We Lead We Deliver : culture of mutual support, caring, work/family balance, continuous improvement and high quality of work.
* Company in strong growth with its dynamism and its challenges.
* Work with the number 1 CRM in the world (Salesforce).
* Challenging and ambitious projects and opportunities to develop your skills and diversify your missions according to your skills.
* Integration and training guaranteed through our #SOLJIT #University
* Competitive Fees based on skills and experience.

**Steps of the selection process:**


phone interview  

psychometric test;  

1st interview (via video conference);  

technical test + code review with technical managers;  

Offer: An offer will be made to the successful applicant, and the start date of the contract will be confirmed.

**Contract start date:**April 2024

title: Change Management Consultant - ERP
description:
**Who We Seek:**

* **Passion Seekers.** You genuinely care about the work that you do and its impact on society.
* **Self-Starters.** You’re a go-getter who isn’t afraid to step up and disrupt the status quo.
* **Entrepreneurs.** You bring fresh ideas to the table, work hard, develop business and consistently seek new challenges.
* **Collaborators.** You’re a great contributor to a high performing team that accomplishes great feats for our clients

 **What You Will Do:**


Attain Partners is searching for a Change Management Consultant who can effectively lead and manage change activities surrounding technology implementations for a higher education institutions.


* Apply a structured methodology and lead change management activities by leveraging Prosci processes, tools, and templates that creates a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by projects/initiatives.
* Develop, support and execute communication efforts by enabling the design, development, delivery and management of key communications.
* Identify and assess change impacts by conducting impact analyses, assessing change readiness, and identifying key stakeholders.
* Develop, support, and execute training efforts by providing input, documenting requirements, and supporting the design and delivery of training programs.
* Prepare stakeholder engagement and training plans that align with technology implementation and is comprehensive of all stakeholders
* Manage all change activities throughout all stages of implementation
* Demonstrate change management expertise related to technology implementations in a higher education setting is ideal
* Perform stakeholder and change impact assessments
* Demonstrate experience in effectively managing change at an organization

 **Job Responsibilities:**

* Complete change management assessments
* Identify, analyze and prepare risk mitigation tactics
* Identify and manage anticipated and persistent resistance
* Consult and coach project teams
* Create actionable deliverables for the core change management plans: Sponsor Plan, People Manager Plan, Communications Plan, and Training Plan
* Create actionable deliverables for any required "Extend" plans, such as the Resistance Management Plan
* Support and engage senior leaders
* Coach people managers and supervisors
* Support organizational design and definition of roles and responsibilities
* Coordinate efforts with other specialists
* Integrate change management activities into the project plan
* Evaluate and ensure user readiness
* Manage stakeholders
* Track and report issues
* Define and measure success metrics and monitor change progress
* Support change management at the organizational level
* Manage the change portfolio

**Required Skills:**

* 5+ years of experience in leading change management workstreams for ERP technology implementations, Oracle Cloud experience is preferred
* Experience in K-12 environment is preferred but not required
* Demonstrate high quality analytical and problem solving skills within time and organizational boundaries
* Ability to work collaboratively in a project team
* Ability to travel nationwide, if needed
* Demonstrates ability to stay current in certifications, training and industry trends and practices
* Effective written and verbal communications a must, with presentation experience
* Experience with managing and leading times

 **Desired Skills:**

* Demonstrated ability to build trusted advisor relationships with clients
* Experience supporting sales and business development

 **Years of Experience:** 5+ Years

 **Certifications:**

* Prosci Change Management Certification

 **Minimum Education Required:**

* Bachelor’s Degree
* Master's Degree preferred

 **About Us:**


Attain Partners is a place for great ideas and the people who have them. As a management, technology, and strategy consulting firm, our professionals provide innovative solutions to revolutionize government, education, health, and nonprofit organizations and positively impact those they serve. We are business analysts, technologists, digital strategists, managers of change, and forward thinkers, with the entrepreneurial drive to shape the future. Our team is present in 35 states and the District of Columbia.


Visit https://attainpartners.com/careers to explore your path forward with Attain Partners.

**Attain Partners is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.**


Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws. For more Information visit EEO, EEO Poster Supplement, Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), and Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA).


If you are unable to complete this application due to a disability, contact this employer to ask for an accommodation or an alternative application process.

title: JD Edwards Technical Consultant
description:

title: Oracle ERP Consultant (GL, AR, AP, CM, EXP)
description:
**Job Summary**
---------------



As an Oracle ERP Cloud Financials Consultant, you will be responsible for implementing, configuring, and supporting the Oracle Cloud Financials suite, including modules such as General Ledger (GL), Accounts Receivable (AR), Accounts Payable


  
**About Apex IT:**



Apex IT is a global consulting firm that provides award-winning services to transform the customer, employee, and student experiences. Since 1997, our Salesforce and Oracle experts have provided a full range of enterprise solutions including CRM and related applications that support sales, marketing, and service; financial reporting; HR; and Business Intelligence. As a remote company, we have top talent all over the United States and India and are continuously growing. We provide our team with a flexible work-life balance in addition to the traditional benefits.


**Job Title:** Oracle ERP Cloud Financials Consultant


**Classification:** Exempt under the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA)


**Reports to:** President


**Work Location/Travel:** Work is remote or on-site at client location. Percentage of travel to client sites, where the travel occurs, such as locally or in specific countries or states, and whether the travel is overnight, varies.


**Essential Functions:**  

* Collaborate with clients to understand their business requirements and map them to Oracle ERP Cloud Financials functionalities.
* Configure Oracle ERP Cloud Financials modules, including GL, AR, AP, CM, and EXP, based on client specifications and best practices.
* Analyze existing processes, identify areas for improvement, and recommend solutions using Oracle ERP Cloud Financials capabilities.
* Design and develop customizations, reports, and integrations as required to meet client needs.
* Conduct system testing and support user acceptance testing to ensure accuracy and adherence to business requirements.
* Provide end-user training on Oracle ERP Cloud Financials modules to enhance user adoption and proficiency.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Oracle ERP Cloud Financials modules, working closely with clients and Oracle support as necessary.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**  

* Maintain and pursue continuing education opportunities, such as training and certification exams.
* Participate on internal projects.
* Provide expertise and help to others, as needed, on projects.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Competency:**  

* Thorough understanding of information technology procedures and practices.
* Flexible to changing needs.
* Organized with attention to detail.
* Good at follow-up
* Willingness to get hands on with the product.
* Works well with a team
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent analytical, logical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
* Thorough understanding of (insert) principles and planning.
* Proficient with, or able to quickly become proficient with, a range of general and specialized applications, software, and hardware used in the organization and the industry.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**  

* May assist with training members of the technical staff.
* May conduct interviews.
* Assigns duties and responsibilities and oversees workflow of project staff.
* May conduct project performance evaluations that are timely and constructive.

**Work Environment:**  

The work environment is remote or on-site at a client location. While remote, employees are expected to provide office space for themselves with a professional background (including virtual backgrounds) and noise level. A reliable and consistent internet connection is required.


**Physical Requirements:**  

* Prolonged periods sitting or standing at a desk and working on a computer.
* Bending, sitting lifting, driving.

**Position Type and expected hours of work:**  

* Full-time work during Apex IT business hours and, at times, outside of business hours, if required.

**Required Education and Experience:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer or Information Science-related field or commensurate experience required.
* Hands-on experience as an Oracle ERP Cloud Financials Consultant, with expertise in GL, AR, AP, CM, and EXP modules.
* In-depth knowledge of Oracle ERP Cloud Financials functionalities, configuration, and best practices.
